text: Murray Lee Eiland, Jr. (born 9 September 1936) is an American writer, scholar, and researcher specializing in ancient oriental rugs. He has written over 20 books about rugs from the Arabian Peninsula, China, Iran, Turkestan, and the Caucasus. He also writes for the Encyclop√¶dia Britannica. His book, Oriental Rugs: A Complete Guide (1998), which he co-wrote with Murray Lee Eiland, III, explains the traditional methods, designs, and materials used in 19th- and 20th-century rugs from the Near and Far East. ==For reading== * * ==References== Category:1936 births
title: Murray Lee Eiland, Jr.
